result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa A Roark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation. To be paid before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions. Obtain all prescriptions from one source.
Attend program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha. Comply with any mental health / psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain / work toward employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber). Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use by agent With Court's permission.

records.addlTxt:
Dated 03/13/17, from the DOC, requesting clarification of the probationary term ordered for count #1.

05/09/17,   per Judge Carter: The JOC should be amended to change the date of violation for count 1.  The date of 10/26/15 should either be removed or changed to 10/23/15.

Defendant Melissa A Roark in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

__ 2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 0 days)
  -  1 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS ***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
Prescribed;
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases;
____Obtain all prescriptions through one source;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain/work toward employment and/or combination of schooling rogram such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha;:
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

RESTITUTION:  $3061.30 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $250.00 + $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 60 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions, STAYED for use of agent with court permission. 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Sentencing hearing on January 19, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Melissa A Roark in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Weathers requests an adjourned date for sentencing.  State is requesting $3,061.30 for restitution.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant will be entering Drug Treatment Court in Milwaukee County.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Weathers states that Defendant is in custody in Milwaukee.  Court adjourns.  Defendant to appear by videoconference from Milwaukee County jail.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
